author: Chazho
title: Great app!
content:
This app appears to send a photo of the receipt up to a server, where the OCR work is done. In any case, the result is exceptionally good and accurate processing. 

Then it's very easy to assign amounts to individual people, allocating expenses separately for each person.

TIP: To assign the cost of an item to people: 1. Select the person first (not the item). 2. Then select all items for which the person will pay some or all of the cost. 3. Select another person, and do the same. If multiple people are signed to the same item, the cost is automatically divided!

The app allows you to add additional items, correct misinterpreted ones, enter any discounts, as well as specifying the amount of sales tax and the percent of tip. 

If the check is handwritten, or there is any other reason that you need to enter all the amounts yourself, you can skip the photo and OCR, and enter the numbers manually.

It's all very easy, and the user interface is well done. I contacted technical support with a potential problem, and their responsiveness was excellent.

content:
This app is both convenient and frustrating to use. Receipt parsing takes a lot of the effort out of bill splitting (👍) but it gets it parses items correctly maybe 70% of the time. Manually editing an item is not a huge pain, but the editing form is buggy and you have to backspace-delete and the whole text up to the point of a typo (selecting a single word in-place does not work for some reason).

The tip view is helpful but additional tips get reset if you reopen the app, altering the original total. 

Some issues with the bill drafting and sharing experience: 

You can share a link to the bill in progress but if you don’t make an account the entire bill disappears when you reopen the app and you have to punch everything in again. This is odd because you can still “join” the bill again through the link after making an account, but can not go back to continue editing it.

Overall this is an app that saves a lot of
time when it works well but wastes time when it does not.

author: Christian Joseph Grant
title: A great idea, poorly executed
content:
I love the idea of this app - and if it worked properly it would be a lifesaver. However this app is terrible at itemizing items. I used a very clear photo of my receipt- the app included the “subtotal”, “tax”, and “total” amounts as line items that I then had to manually delete. Then, the app added a 58 dollar tip and I have no idea where they came from even after investigating my receipt. A 20% tip on our bill (which we left) was only ~20 dollars. 

This app also does not let you edit the dollar amount of tax charged (in my case the app put it down as 0, which isn’t correct), which seems like a massive oversight. You should at least have the option to manually enter the amount of percentage of tax charged considering how bad the app is at itemizing. 

I am giving two stars, simply because the app DID itemize the actual items on my receipt correctly, with correct dollar amount and (close enough) names. With some manual override, I was about to get the bill within ~10 dollars of the actual amount paid - so in the end it can still be useful. This app has a lot of potential, it just needs a better algorithm at itemizing, and a manual override feature for the amount of tax paid.

author: alexdhad
title: helpful but needs several fixes
content:
I like Tab a lot and use it often to split meals with groups. I’m surprised I hadn’t heard about it sooner!

However, after using it for a couple months, I have realized there are several bugs that are super annoying to deal with. 

- Uploading a photo you’ve taken separately, instead of using the in-app camera to take a pic of the receipt, often results in incorrect tallying (by several hundred dollars). I then have to manually upload each item and its price instead. 

- When manually uploading, you for some reason can’t add tax? I have to add it as “additional tip.” 

- If your receipt name is too long, you can’t exit from the receipt. You have to restart the entire app to get back to the home page. 

- The most bizarre one: why can’t I use more than 5 letters to name someone? Please change this. 

These fixes would make a HUGE difference in the usability of the app.

author: Rosentrotter
title: This app is a must have
content:
Rarely do I write reviews. This app has likely saved me money (of me missing a few dollars/cents trying to figure out this math on my own) and so many headaches splitting bills of large groups at restaurants that do not want to take the time to do separate checks. 

Over time, I have actually found it easier to just use this app rather than asking the server to do separate checks. In my experience with Tab, if you’re willing to do the work of figuring out who got what yourself, your servers get the order right, your food comes quicker (since they don’t have to spend a long time at the computer typing everything in carefully), and it makes the experience for the group better as a whole. 

A few feature suggestions:

Appetizers: A conversation that tends to come up when deciding who got what is “well this person are more of this than this person.” Can you create a way to say “this person had 4 of 12 items from this” instead of splitting it 12 ways and tapping it four times? Technically the app does this, but it requires a bit of extra taps. 

Alcohol: Guests may feel it’s appropriate to tip more for elaborate cocktails than they would for a pizza. Servers also tip out the bartender. Is there a way to figure out how to skew tips up based on how much of the bill was alcohol? For example, 15% for the food, 20% for the alcohol.

author: kingdrockula
title: Way too many steps for a simple bill
content:
So where the Plates app is too simple and constrained, Tab is far too complex for a simple bill. I have to first scan the receipt (which doesn’t always go well). Then I have to manually type each diner’s name. Then I have to enter each line item with both a price and a name (or correct the OCR from the picture). It’s like a full 5 minutes for a single lunch bill. Oh but wait, the stupid Tax line doesn’t work, so I have to record tax as a “second tip.”

Then I can finally calculate what each person owed. It’s insane how many steps this is for a single meal. At this point, I might as well keep using the Excel spreadsheet I wrote with formulas for splitting tax and tip.

author: Pharod
title: Amazing idea but execution could be better
content:
I spent a few hours trying to find an app that can snap and OCR receipts. Tab was the only one I’ve found and it looked very promising. 
Unfortunately for my specific use case it didn’t work out well, but I still believe it’s a great app. 

A few notes for devs, hope this could be useful:

- Since my checks are in foreign language I have to translate these using Google Translate and save image of translated receipts. Luckily Tab can use receipt image! Unfortunately it’s OCR capability seems to be limited, it can’t handle these translated receipts well, even text actually look nice and sharp. Probably just need better OCR library. 
- Somewhere closer to final step it tells me that $23 is not distributed. I expect a shortcut here to let me quickly fix this. It’s not here. Also on a step where items are marked it could do better job showing issues like not assigned items. 
- Not all receipts are in USD, people in other countries use other currencies 😏

content:
If you just want to split everything that’s already as printed, like a restaurant bill, it’s good. 

If you’re trying to apply a specific tax percentage to figure out how much someone owes you for footing the bill, it’s not worth.

You can only change the dollar amount for the tax, not the actual percentage.

For example, on the receipt it says the calculated dollar amount over the subtotal. This app asks you to enter that specifically.

You can’t change the tax percentage to determine what that amount is in app. You would have to do that separately and comeback to in put it. For each person.

At that point you might as well just do the rest of the calculations on your own.

author: DeanGFL
title: Sometimes useful but mostly garbage
content:
The idea is great and functionality is good many times. The problems are many though.
- You can't enter in more than 5 characters for someone's name. Seems like such a stupid limitation in a modern app
- The bills OFTEN aren't parsed correctly requiring a lot of manual effort to correct each item, take a really long time to parse or on occasion simply error out
- There's a really bad bug when you need to edit the name or amount of an item and instead of letting you put the cursor in the middle to fix 1 letter, it'll put the cursor at the end so you have to erase the whole title and retype it
- You can't export the original receipt image or the final breakdown anywhere
- The app needs full camera flash when taking pictures EVERY TIME
- There's no way to breakdown amounts unevenly. For example if me and my buddy got beers but I got 4 and he got 1, we can't specify that in the app

author: Pinochle lady
title: Love the app!
content:
I love the app. It helped me split the check fairly between 11 people. It was easy to use. But I do have a few suggestions. I usually have a meal with a big group(10-20) and everyone wants a separate check. When the restaurant  will not do that I will pay the check and then tell everyone what they owe. Most of the group is technically challenged (seniors) so have no clue how to use an app or do not want to so I get stuck with figuring out the check. It would be helpful if;

1. I could identify the group before I get the check,

2. Be able to see a snapshot of the details for one person  at a time after I identify what they had as part of the totals so I could show them and 

3. Allow cents when entering a tip (sometimes when using a credit card we add a tip amount that would round the total)

4. For me the most important one would be to be able somehow to show all the details of the bill when emailing it or texting it or printing it. It only shows the “All Up” $ and a list of the items assigned to each person but not the detail prices, taxes, tip, etc.  for each person.

author: JoSchmo007
title: It's nice, but needs some polishing
content:
The image processing is the main attraction. The accuracy of extracting itemized items is decent. Could be better, although I realize that's not an easy task. The app may mistakes items with the word 'tips' in it (e.g. S-tips/steak tips) as included tips and so it will not appear in the list of items. Deleting the included tips should automatically add this misinterpreted item to the list, but it doesn't. It has to be entered manually. 
I'd like to see the tax displayed as a percentage as well. Because I know the tax in my area is 7%, I'd quickly know if the list of items is wrong. I also would like to see a pre/post tax option to for tip calculations.

author: pnyc12
title: Incredible app to split bills at restaurants
content: The functionality and user experience in this app is unparalleled. I’ve been looking for a good bill splitting app for a long time and this one is perfect. It then let’s you go even further and not only identify items that were shared - but also items that were shared unevenly. author: Amyyh0
title: Highly recommended; used often
content:
I recommend this app to my friends whenever I go out to eat! It is super easy to use — you just take a photo of the bill and then the app magically itemizes the bill.

You can then correct anything per line and rename items.

After you do so, you can then add each person, and then select which item they had. It’s also super useful if splitting one dish between multiple people.

The app then calculates all the tip, tax, and then the totals PER person (also itemizes in detail). If your friends have the app and are linked to Venmo, you can request in-app.

It’s a game changer and I use it all the time when eating out. I’m sometimes able to request (and receive) payment from all my friends even before the waiter picks up the check!

Again, highly recommended.

Will be recommending and using this app during my next trip!

title: App is great

Updated:

Forgot to check the FAQ, so updated my review after a response from the developer. Super useful, and I will continue to share with everyone I dine with. 

Previous review: 

This app is great, one change that needs to happen is if I order multiple of one item, I should be able to add myself multiple times to an item so it properly splits the costs. For example, on a recent tab, I ordered 3 drinks when everyone else ordered 1. We couldn’t properly split the tab in the app because I had a disproportionate amount of drinks compared to everyone else. Otherwise love the app and has great potential.

Also side note, there should be a function in the app to share it with people so they don’t need to look it up in the App Store.

author: rebs21012
title: This app is amazing
content:
There are a few weird functionality things that I wish would be fixed or modified (happy to provide feedback if the developers reach out) but all in all this app has saved our friends group so much time and energy splitting the bill. We have a few people that don’t drink, or only eat special or specific food and so when we go out a few people always owe a lot more than others. This app is so easy to use, we use it all the time now.

1. I didn’t understand how the birthday button worked, but now that I do I love it! Allocate everything and then hit the button and say whose bday it is and it splits it amongst everything.

2. We had a weird tax on the bill last night and it took us a while to figure out how to edit it. There were 2 “sub” taxes listed and a total and the app added all 3 in.

3. It’s hard to label the bill. You have to go back in and hit it from a weird screen. 

4. I love that I can text the breakdown of the costs to my friends, but like the layout and info of the breakdown in the app. Might be nice if you could text the image of the breakdown by person, instead of the whole thing, or for it to make a pdf of the breakdown that I could text to everyone! 

All in all the app is great and with weird situations the app usually has a response, it’s just hard to figure it out when that happens. We all love it. Most useful app I own by far!!!!

author: Alxvry
title: Unknown Unclaimed Amount
content:
There’s bug where an unknown unclaimed amount is added to a new bill.

Update: we’ll duh on me! Now knowing some line items captured by OCR shouldn’t be included in the “menu”. Makes sense now. It took a few attempts to finally figure out how to tag line items to people properly.  The only thing left to mention is if you include the tax in your splits, the the next page should be $0 for taxes.  If you remove the tax line item and add the tax in the next page, then your tip amount is before taxes and you’ll have to manually split the taxes.  Confused you yet?  In the end, I’ve figured it out.  Great app for large groups!

author: Danielle Pan
title: Great potential!
content:
Great app but there are some features I’d love to see in the future! 

Splitters each with a unique color for easier organization (maybe opening up the possibility for a dark theme or choosing the color gradient in settings), splitters’ names longer than 5 characters, ability to add additional surcharges (3% health tax), itemized individual receipts that can be shared in-app via text message or other social media, compatibility with iMessage or a URL link to claim items on receipt without downloading the app (à la Jackbox games), ability to edit item list/taxes while pulling up the image of the receipt (in case the receipt has already been thrown away or lost), and saved common splitters. 

I’m also not too into having the camera on in the main menu without selecting New Bill. 

I’ve also encountered a bug where the item name is uneditable. The workaround I’ve found is Select All > Delete and then manually entering the correct item name.

title: Brilliant free app
content:
Just used it for the first time a few days ago and it was so easy to split the bill. All my friends downloaded the app as well after they saw how great it was. Saved us such a headache working things out manually. So fun to highlight everything. Thanks!!

Moving back to Australia soon, hoping it's going to work there too!!

author: mikemcnally123xoxo

content: i would equate the happiness i felt the moment i used Tab to the moment i give birth to my first born child. you seriously cannot go wrong

author: ialexryan
title: AWFUL UPDATE - deletes your data unless you give them your email!
content:
For years, Tab has saved bills locally once you’re done with them. I rely on that to do the math while I’m still at the table, then have people send me money later.

The developers have CHANGED the behavior, with no notice. Bills are now DELETED once you leave the app, unless you sign up for a totally unnecessary account with them. The app still has the technical ability to save bills locally of course, and iCloud can sync and backup app data, but they have to find some leverage to get us to give them our email addresses so they can sell them or monetize us somehow.

I’m at least accustomed to that kind of selling-out by app developers at this point. But what I cannot abide is lacking the common decency to TELL your users what you’re doing. I relied on behavior that’s been consistent for years to save ten minutes of unpleasant manual entry work, and you tossed it in the trash with no warning, for no other reason than to strongarm me into signing up for another account I don’t need. Shame on you.

author: QueenBHart
title: My favorite app
content: Makes dinners out with friends so much easier. Love this!!

author: Asher1125
title: Must get
content: Amazing UI. 10/10 would recommend

author: KJF-DC
title: Wow
content: Had a chance to test this app yesterday after the fact. My old-fashioned mental calculation was confirmed, to the penny, by the app and much more quickly.

author: Shealewwy
title: Amazing App
content:
I had this idea tonight while I was with friends. As a designer and product developer, I couldn’t do this better myself. Good work guys!! Grandma everything so well and makes life way easier. 

Only tip for design would be to separate the section where it says the person that already claimed item. This should be a different color or more bold so it’s easier to tell what’s already been claimed on the tab! But other than that, you have a fan! Now I don’t have to stress about splitting the bill anymore. Good work guys!

author: SillyRabbitTrix
title: Taxes don’t show??
content: I have tried using tab for the first time in over a month.  The items purchased are showing up, but sales taxes are not.  Very frustrating.  I don’t see a way to manually add in sales taxes.  Please fix.

author: gl&s

content: This app works beautifully.  I wish I had this 10 years ago.  Completely solves the check splitting problem.  Unlike years ago, many restaurants will provide separate bills.  Even so, it may be better to get one tab and use the app—you have more control.

author: urbanizedanimal
title: Great app, but minor bug
content:
It’s a great app and makes bill splitting much less of a headache. However, I’m on an iPhone X and I’m unable to scroll through the summary of names when viewing a past bill.

Edited:
Thanks for fixing that bug, Tab developers! I have another feature request. Currently, if I want to add an additional tip on top of an included tip, Tab only allows me to add a percentage tip. I would like the ability to add a numeric tip as well

author: Stayclassics
title: Has potential to be a must have app by falls short
content: It’s a great app to organize a check. I’m usually the guy in my group that Venmo everyone their portion of the check. This app made it super easy to split it by pressing the items. The part that’s missing is that, there is no way to request a person their portion of the check. They have to all download the app and choose themselves. This is a bit impractical when you have a large group and possible friends that don’t want to download the app or people you don’t know well. It would be so much better if you can send requests via Venmo since it already integrates with it.

author: EmKolps

content: I love this app an abnormal amount. It makes splitting dishes way less taboo and completely acceptable because it’s fun!!! Thank you for the work put into this app, my friends and I really love it.

author: Khalilramah
title: Great App, simple to use but ...
content:
After splitting the bills, one should be able to verify the items they took on their respective tabs. Like a breakdown of their total and not just the general total. 

Also people should be able to individually decide how much they’re willing to tip on their respective tabs. 

One more thing, sharing bills and breakdowns to other apps for people who don’t have or can’t have Tabs installed.

author: lkd412
title: Expiring bills is a major flaw!
content: Why do bills need to expire after an hour? When charging friends for bills from yesterday (or from a recent trip), it would be nice for them to have more than an hour to access the bills.  Otherwise, the makings of a good app so far.

There should also be a custom tip. I know there’s “included tip” but that’s not really the same.

author: lmarms

author: K19845
title: Love It!
content: This is a great app. One suggestion I have is to be able to edit a person’s name or have the ability to remove them all together. Other than that, this app is exactly what I’ve been needing!  I will use this all the time now. At large dinners it was always a hassle to split bills and people would get charged equally for tip and tax but always felt it was unfair to get charged the same tip and tax rate when they got a cheaper meal - so this app solves that problem for me!

author: pdk_spamela
title: Good, could be great
content: I recently used this app for the first time and was able to split a bill between seven people fairly easily and give them their total. I had a question come up later but could not get back to the details to verify that we had split the bill correctly, adding some audit trail would be really useful in this situation. Additionally, another great feature would be to be able to send out, via text or email, an itemized receipt to each of the bill participants. The people I regularly split large bills with have a wide range of comfort with technology, it would be nice to be able to send them something more detailed than just their totals but show them the items selected and their portion of taxes and tip. Asking them to join the bill from their device is way beyond what they would be willing to do. With these two enhancements, this would be the perfect app for my needs.

author: Garage sunset
title: Not accurate
content: I was so excited to use this app, but we also had to break out the pen and part. Great concept but not accurate. The tax was also double the amount of the bill?? Our bill was like $240 and tax came out as $230 and I wasn’t able to edit it. So everyone abandoned the AP and resorted back to traditional methods to sort out the bill... bummer! Was a brilliant concept!
